Suppose he were to confess his sins in the great Nirvana sūtra.
If someone repents, their faults will surely cease.
Their faults will surely be extinguished.
He can also become the second most faithful person before him.
That's because it removes evil.

source_sentence: 復次善男子譬如有人(至)則已墮於十住數中。
translation: "Furthermore, good sons, suppose a person (arriving) has fallen into one of the ten abodes.
Commentary.
Sengliang said.
"It's a good point to clarify that goodness arises.
That's why they say they've fallen into the number of the ten abodes.
Those ten abodes also don't regress.
It's because this person also doesn't regress.
It's explained below.
'A sūtra is on the ear.
He'll be reborn and never lose his right view.'
Baoliang said.
"The sixth is a metaphor for someone who dedicates themselves to attaining.
It's because it's certain to fall into the number of the tenth ground.

source_sentence: 或有眾生是佛弟子(至)如是四人為世間依。
translation: Perhaps there are sentient beings who are disciples of the Buddha (to) thus four people who are the basis of the world.
Commentary.
Baoliang said.
'Going forward is initiating someone who is deeply convinced.'
It's like the seventh one in the present.
This shows that those who have arisen in the family have no good intentions.
They're also those who study the great vehicle.
Some see others gaining profit.
Some may crave fame and praise.
That's why they read the scriptures.
Still, though...
sentient beings aren't made of wood or stone.
They will themselves realize the power of the sūtras later.
They'll then attain nearness to the path.
Venerating the legacy of the Saṃgha School, he said.
"The causes explained previously are distant.
I'm afraid that people's minds will be cut off on their own.
That's why it's cited again.
Don't ask whether it's true or false.
Just label it to your mind.
It will be profoundly helpful on its own.
